newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Hong Kong gold end down on European sales.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong gold end down on European sales.

text.p: Hong Kong bullion edged down on Monday from its New York close on European sell orders, but activity was paralysed by a severe attack of bearishness, gold dealers and traders said.
Bullion prices dipped slightly on professional selling and European sell orders on precious metals, gold traders said.
"Turnover was very small," a bullion trader at a European bank said, noting that there had been some two-way professional business.
The market felt resistance at US$380.60 and strong support at about US$379.90, and gold sources noted that intra-day trade had been marked by low bids and high offers.
"There is a generally bad feeling in the market," a gold trader at an international bullion house's local office said.
Bullion ended at US$379.95/380.45 an ounce Monday against New York's US$380.15/65 close on Friday.
Local gold ended HK$7 lower at HK$3,503 a tael.
The carry over charge at the Chinese Gold and Silver Exchange fell to -6 from -5.5 on Friday.
While physical demand was normally healthy at current price levels, an overall bearish sentiment had pushed buyers to the sidelines in anticipation of a further price drop, traders said.
"Players don't want to sell at this level, they don't want to buy either, which is why the market is stuck in the doldrums," a source at an international bank's Hong Kong office said.
Other gold traders said that the physical market had been largely saturated at the US$382 level, but that buying could resume if prices ducked even lower.
The premium on gold bars were still hovering around 55-60 U.S cents, sources said.
BULLION -
Hong Kong midday - US$380.30/80
Hong Kong open - US$380.30/80
Hong Kong close - US$379.95/380.45
New York close - US$380.15/65
HONG KONG TAEL MARKET -
Midday - HK$3,505
Open - HK$3,505
Close - HK$3,503
Previous close - HK$3,510
-- Mishi Saran (852) 2843 6358
